http4s

http4s is a typeful, purely functional HTTP library for client and server applications written in Scala.

Principles

http4s is designed in the spirit of the Typelevel ecosystem. The pure functional side of Scala is favored to promote composability and easy reasoning about your code. The core is build on an immutable case class model of HTTP requests and responses, shared by the client and the server.

The type system is employed to increase self-documentation and compile-time verification. Common headers are lazily parsed to semantically meaningful types, and typeclasses are employed for safe encoding and decoding of bodies.

http4s is also asynchronous for higher concurrency. Clients and servers both respond with a [Task]. Bodies are modeled as a scalaz-streams for performant chunking of large messages in constant memory.

Integrations

http4s server applications can be deployed to blaze, the native platform for maximum speed. First-class support is also offered for WAR deployments or an embedded Jetty or Tomcat server.

Client applications can run on either blaze or an async-http-client backend.

Several libraries useful in everyday HTTP programming, such as [circe] and [argonaut], are integrated in optional modules.

Getting started

Pick a compatible version of your stack, and please proceed to the docs.
